content: bad batch socks by marie-elyse dugal in collaboration with the lab fibers ravelry marie-elyse dugal patterns tipoussins projects instagram @marieelysedugal #badbatchsocks my family has always enjoyed the star wars movies and shows and these socks were inspired by the good soldiers of the bad batch i designed these for my husband who is a fantastic sock knitter and the biggest star wars fan i know may the force be with you �1 yarn and notions yarn 100g fingering weight sample in everyday sock fingering by the lab fibers colourway moon dust needles 2 5mm ***i used 2 25mm for the cuff to get a snug fit then 2 5mm for the leg and foot as the rank and file stitch of the panel makes a tighter fabric you may want to use 2 75mm if you are a very tight knitter i use needles with a long cable for magic loop or use your preferred needles such as 9 in circulars or dpns gauge 8sts = 1 inch in stockinette abbreviations co cast on k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit slip the next 2 stitches consecutively knitwise then return these stitches to the left needle and knit them together through the back loop sl slip_stitch purlwise unless otherwise specified sl wyf slip_stitch purlwise while holding the yarn in front of work sl wyb slip_stitch purlwise while holding the yarn at back of work yf yarn in front of work yb yarn in back of work pm place marker sm slip marker bor beginning of round kfb knit into the front and then into the back of the same stitch increase of 1 stitch �2 *** the rank and file stitch is executed by a repeat of 4 rounds as described in the leg pattern instructions it is not difficult to learn but it is important to pay attention to the placement of the yarn sometimes in front sometimes in back sometimes being moved back and forth it quickly becomes habit and the result is stunning *** i have made a little video available in my reels on instagram and also saved in the thumbnail for the bad batch socks showing how to execute the second round i could not find a video on youtube as i had to rework the execution of the stitch so it would work in the round instructions note that the charts for the pattern repeats can be found at the end of all instructions co 54 64 74 stitches using your preferred method such as long tail or german twisted separate stitches equally in two 27 32 37 st per needle if using magic loop or as needed if using another method beaded rib cuff joining in the round place bor marker and begin the beaded rib pattern as follows round 1 * p2 k3 5 6 7 times p2 repeat from * to end of round round 2 * p2 k1 p1 k1 5 6 7 times
